item.title: In Photos: The Aftermath of the Maha Kumbh Mela Stampede
item.description: Many were feared dead after millions of Hindu pilgrims at a huge Hindu festival in India rushed to bathe in holy river waters.

item.title: Three Countries Officially Quit Major West African ECOWAS Alliance
item.description: Burkina Faso, Mali and Niger accused the bloc of having double standards in punishing their military juntas. Negotiations failed to change their minds...

item.title: Citizenship by Birthright? By Bloodline? Migration Is Complicating Both.
item.description: In a world where people are more mobile than ever, nations are struggling to recalibrate who can be a citizen.

item.title: Stampede at India’s Maha Kumbh Mela Hindu Festival: Many Feared Dead
item.description: People were trampled as pilgrims at the Maha Kumbh Mela, one of the world’s biggest gatherings, came together at the confluence of two sacred rivers, ...

item.title: Catholic Church in the Philippines Accused of Impunity Over Priest Abuse
item.description: A watchdog group, Bishop Accountability, said it had found scores of clerics with ties to the country who have been publicly accused of sexual abuse. ...
